title: Do You Need a Co-Sponsor at eXp Realty?
excerpt: Key takeaway: A co-sponsor at eXp Realty is optional, but can give you access to additional systems, training, and relationships beyond your primary sponsor. Whether…
content:
Key takeaway: A co-sponsor at eXp Realty is optional, but can give you access to additional systems, training, and relationships beyond your primary sponsor. Whether you need one depends on gaps in your primary sponsor’s value and your business goals.

TL;DR About Co-Sponsors at eXp Realty

  • Optional secondary support for new agents
  • Must be named during onboarding
  • Can fill training or tool gaps in primary sponsor’s offering
  • Revenue share is earned by primary and co-sponsor
  • As co-sponsors, Smart Agent Alliance provides value of 2 agents, not just 1

If you’re joining eXp Realty, you already know you should pick a primary sponsor. That’s the easy part. But since May 2025, eXp’s thrown in a curveball: you can now name a co-sponsor. Think of it as giving someone else a seat at your support table — they get a slice of the revenue share from your deals. 

Sounds like a free upgrade, right? Not always. The right co-sponsor can plug a hole in your business plan and help you scale faster. The wrong one? Just a name on paper collecting a check that diminishes your primary sponsor’s earnings.

Do You Need a Co-Sponsor at eXp Realty?
When Does It Make Sense to Choose a Co-Sponsor?
What Kind of Value Can a Co-Sponsor Provide?
Downsides of Choosing a Co-Sponsor (Commission Splits, Timing)
What if Your Co-Sponsor is Too Involved or Redundant?
Can You Change Your Co-Sponsor Later?
How Smart Agent Alliance Supports Agents Without a Co-Sponsor

Dual Sponsorship Power
Top Real Estate Coaching:
Marketing Assets
Plug & Play Systems so you gain passive income:
Inspiring Community:
Frequently Asked Questions

Do You Need a Co-Sponsor at eXp Realty?

Here’s the deal: No, you don’t need one. Plenty of agents crush it with just a strong primary sponsor. But if yours is missing certain systems, tools, or mentoring, an eXp co-sponsor can be your secret weapon. They can open doors to specialized programs, top-tier training, or high-value connections that speed up your growth.

You add a co-sponsor after you’ve joined at eXp Realty, not on your join application (that’s reserved for your primary sponsor). Name that co-sponsor within 5 days of being active at eXp. 

Both your primary and co-sponsor get paid from eXp’s company dollar, not from your commission check. So, if they’re offering real value without charging you extra, that’s as close to a free lunch as you’ll ever get in real estate.

Example: Your primary sponsor’s a contract wizard but couldn’t teach agent attraction to save their life. Bring in a co-sponsor, like Smart Agent Alliance, and suddenly you’ve got proven funnels and recruiting strategies working for you while you sleep.

When Does It Make Sense to Choose a Co-Sponsor?

A co-sponsor is worth naming when they bring real, proven value your primary sponsor can’t or won’t provide. That could mean specialized systems, niche expertise, or marketing tools that directly move the needle for your business.

Other smart reasons?

  • You’re set on having a local sponsor for in-person support.
  • You’re navigating a personal landmine — like a friend or sibling expecting to be your sponsor — but you’d rather tap into a powerhouse eXp sponsor team for actual value. Naming them as co-sponsor can keep relationships intact and business booming.

Just remember: “nice” doesn’t equal “valuable.” Always vet your co-sponsor’s staying power and track record at eXp. The last thing you need is your secondary support ghosting you in six months, leaving nothing but dead weight on your revenue share line. And yes, sending someone a check for doing nothing won’t change your business, but it will shrink your primary sponsor’s paycheck, and you have no idea if that will affect their willingness (or ability) to go the extra mile for you later.

What Kind of Value Can a Co-Sponsor Provide?

In short: The best co-sponsors fill gaps, they don’t just clone what your primary sponsor already offers. And here’s the kicker most agents miss: a co-sponsor is just one person. Your full upline and all that potential extra value and support comes entirely from your primary sponsor. That’s why choosing the right primary matters more than any “bonus” name you tack on later.

So, what might a single eXp agent realistically bring to the table?

  • Local expertise: great for hyper-local insights, but don’t expect them to hand you their best business tips because you’re also their competition.
  • Local meetups: more face-to-face time if you thrive on in-person connection.
  • Onboarding support: getting you up and running without fumbling through the basics.
  • Weekly meetings:  just be honest with yourself… if the meetings aren’t truly valuable, you won’t attend
  • Passive income support — like done-for-you marketing funnels, webinars, calls, and automated drip campaigns for agent prospects. (Smart Agent Alliance delivers all of this as a co-sponsor and more as a primary sponsor.)

Many agents in Smart Agent Alliance bring on co-sponsors for hyper-specialized training while we, as the primary sponsor, handle the heavy lifting like core systems, weekly coaching, and the kind of team culture that keeps you engaged and producing.

Downsides of Choosing a Co-Sponsor (Commission Splits, Timing)

The biggest downside is adding someone who benefits financially from your production but contributes nothing in return leaving you frustrated and wondering why you bothered.

There’s also a hidden risk: when you add a co-sponsor, your primary sponsor earns a little less from your deals. You can’t predict if that will change their willingness to invest in you down the road.

Remember, sponsors can run “side hustles” and charge agents for access to extra value. If your primary sponsor decides to put a price tag on something you suddenly want later, that move might be more tempting for them if you’ve diminsihed their revenue with a co-sponsor.

If your primary sponsor already delivers 360° support, a co-sponsor may offer zero tangible benefit. But, if you want a co-sponsor, don’t miss the 5-day naming opportunity. Once you’re onboarded, you can’t add a co-sponsor later without leaving eXp and rejoining.

What if Your Co-Sponsor is Too Involved or Redundant?

In short: When roles overlap, you can end up with mixed messages, wasted time, or full-blown politics in your upline. It can be like having two “bosses” and you’re stuck getting too much information.

Before you add a co-sponsor, nail down exactly who’s doing what:

  • Onboarding: Who’s walking you through eXp’s systems and processes so nothing falls through the cracks?
  • Community: Whose calls are actually worth your time and which ones can you skip without missing value?
  • Training: Who’s delivering the content you truly need so you’re not drowning in duplicate sessions?
  • Recruiting: Who’s running your agent attraction systems and follow-up so prospects get a clear, unified message instead of a two-person sales pitch?

Without clearly knowing who does what best, you risk stalling your own growth while getting pulled into a tug-of-war over your business plan.

Example: We’ve seen agents join with a co-sponsor and spend their first six months bouncing between two weekly masterminds, getting conflicting marketing advice, and drowning in so many ideas they implement… none of them. That’s not “extra support”. That’s organized chaos.

A good co-sponsor amplifies your primary sponsor’s strengths. A bad one just duplicates effort, muddies direction, and drains your focus.

Can You Change Your Co-Sponsor Later?

Maybe, unlike your primary sponsor, a co-sponsor might be changed. You’ll need to petition eXp with a valid reason, and if they approve it, you can swap your current co-sponsor for another.

Sounds simple, but here’s the fine print: this rule is new, rarely tested, and there’s no public playbook on how often eXp says “yes.” Your reason might need to be more than “we don’t vibe anymore.” Think along the lines of a co-sponsor leaving eXp, failing to deliver promised value, or otherwise becoming unable to support you.

Bottom line: don’t choose a co-sponsor thinking you can easily trade them in later. Make your first choice as if you’re keeping them long-term, and treat the ability to change as a just-in-case safety net, not part of your strategy.

How Smart Agent Alliance Supports Agents Without a Co-Sponsor

Choosing whether to add a co-sponsor can shape your career from day one. If you pick the right team, you may not need one at all. At Smart Agent Alliance, we deliver both the broad foundational support and the specialized expertise other agents have to cobble together with multiple sponsors.

Here’s what you get right away when you join eXp Realty and name a Smart Agent Alliance founder as your sponsor:

Dual Sponsorship Power

Frequently Asked Questions

Is a Co-Sponsor Required at eXp Realty?

No. Co-sponsors are optional and must be named within 5 days of becoming active at eXp. Your primary sponsor is chosen on your join application, but a co-sponsor is added afterward. The right one can fill value gaps; the wrong one just takes a slice of your revenue share line.

Can a Co-Sponsor Be in My Local Market?

Yes. They can be anywhere eXp operates. Location doesn’t limit support, but local co-sponsors may offer in-person meetups or connections. Just make sure you’re getting real business value, not just someone to grab coffee with.

What Are the Pros and Cons of Having a Co-Sponsor?

A co-sponsor can add expertise, tools, and relationships your primary sponsor doesn’t offer. Downsides include less revenue share for your primary sponsor, possible redundancy, and risk of paying for no actual support through eXp’s company dollar.

Can I Change My Co-Sponsor Later?

Maybe. You can petition eXp Realty with a “valid” reason and potentially get a different co-sponsor.  You can’t do that with your primary sponsor. You can only add or change a primary sponsor by leaving eXp and rejoining.

What Happens If I Don’t Pick a Co-Sponsor? Will I Miss Out?

Not if you have a strong primary sponsor. Many agents, especially in Smart Agent Alliance, skip co-sponsors and still get more value than most agents juggling two sponsors.

Key takeaway: Yes. eXp Realty requires every new agent to name a primary sponsor on their application. This choice is permanent unless you leave for 12 months. The right sponsor unlocks training, systems, and a motivated upline. The wrong one? You’ll get radio silence and zero added value.

TL;DR About Sponsors at eXp Realty

  • Required on every new agent application
  • Unlocks your full 7-level upline support
  • Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack = double the value
  • Permanent unless you exit for a year
  • Wrong choice = no support, no network

Joining eXp Realty isn’t like walking into a brick-and-mortar office and shaking hands with your broker-in-charge. Every agent gets eXp’s unmatched tech, training, and national community. That’s the baseline. 

But your primary sponsor, the person you name on your application, can pile on even more: private masterminds, done-for-you marketing tools, and direct access to leaders who actually know your name. 

Pick right, and you’ll plug into a support line that accelerates your production and even does the hard lifting for you to gain a passive income stream. Pick wrong, and you’ll be alone at 2 a.m. Googling “how to get into eXp World.” Oh, and you only get one shot at naming them. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Do You Need a Sponsor at eXp Realty?

Frequently Asked Questions

Do You Need a Sponsor at eXp Realty?

In short: Yes. eXp Realty gives you one opportuntiy to name a sponsor when joining eXp, and that choice is permanent unless you leave for 12 months. It’s not just a form to fill—it decides which upline you’ll be connected to for support, resources, and mentorship.

This isn’t a ceremonial title. Your sponsor is the gatekeeper to extra potential value like exclusive trainings, marketing systems, community, and leadership access that can fast-track your growth. Some sponsors vanish after you sign; others, like Smart Agent Alliance + the Wolf Pack, actually show up. Ours launches you with onboarding help, live masterminds, and training that will move your do-more-deals needle. 

How a Good Sponsor Affects Your Income Potential

A strong sponsor line can increase both your commission income and passive revenue share earnings. They might hand you proven systems, lead funnels, and attraction tools you’d otherwise have to build, and pay for, yourself.

For example, Smart Agent Alliance agents launch with branded lead-gen landing pages,  stay top of mind prospect email drips, and a turnkey agent attraction funnel—day one. That means they’re closing transactions faster and building a passive income stream most agents don’t even consider until year two—right about the time they see their friends cashing revenue share checks and start Googling “how to change your sponsor at eXp” (spoiler: you can’t).

How Strong Sponsor Support Leads to More Production and Retention

The bottom line: Agents with engaged sponsors close more deals and stay at eXp longer. Support breeds confidence, confidence breeds production, and production breeds retention.

Inside Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack, agents get weekly top strategies ideas, a supportive community, and direct access to leaders like Mike Sherrard. That’s why this sponsor line has some of the highest retention rates in the company, and why “burnout” isn’t in our vocabulary.

What Should New Agents Look for in a Sponsor?

Here’s the answer: Choose a sponsor who shows up on day one with proven systems, structured onboarding, and the organization to help you close more deals immediately. They should pour into you for free—no hidden “coaching packages” or upsells later. And make sure they have a plan for passive income support; ignoring that is the #1 regret of current eXp agents.

Avoid “promises tomorrow” and pick “proven today.” Pro tip: Ask exactly what you’ll get the moment you join. If the answer is vague, filled with buzzwords, or sounds like they’re stalling for time, keep moving. You don’t need a motivational pen pal; you need a sponsor who delivers results.

Will eXp Assign a Sponsor If You Skip That Field?

In short: No. While eXp used to assign a random sponsor, the current practice is to leave your upline blank if you don’t name one. That means you’ll have no primary sponsor, and no extra layer of support, without intentionally choosing a sponsor.

On paper, that might sound harmless. In reality, you’re opting out of the free coaching, systems, and community that great sponsors provide. Without a sponsor, you’ll only get eXp’s standard tools and training which, while they are great, they are not the private masterminds, onboarding help, or revenue share guidance that can transform your business. If you’re joining anyway, why pass up the chance to connect with a powerhouse team like Smart Agent Alliance that’s built to fast-track both your production and passive income?

Pro tip: When you fill out your eXp application, double-check the sponsor field before you hit submit because if it’s blank, you can’t retroactively claim the value of a top-tier sponsor team. However, if you realize the mistake before you’re active at eXp, you can contact eXp Support to correct it. Once you’re active with eXp, your only option is leaving for 12 months and rejoining.

Do Unassigned Agents Still Contribute to the Rev Share Pool?

Yes. Your commissions still trigger revenue share payouts even if you don’t name a sponsor. The catch? You have no control over who gets paid, and they won’t lift a finger to help you, mostly because they have no idea you exist.

Why don’t they know? Because without a sponsor, the money your deals generate gets tossed into a bonus pool paid to Tiers 1–3 in someone else’s upline. It’s not personal. It’s just math. That “extra” is pulled from eXp’s 20% company dollar until you cap, so it doesn’t feel like a bill, but it is money you could have working for you.

Going sponsorless is like paying for a subscription you never use, except the “service” you’re skipping is support, training, and growth guidance. Handing free income to a random agent with no expectation of return is business malpractice. With Smart Agent Alliance, every dollar you generate also funds your free tools, live masterminds, and done-for-you agent attraction funnel so you actually see a return on the revenue you create. 

Can I Attract an eXp Downline if I Don’t Have an Upline?

Yes, but if you don’t have a primary sponsor, the smartest move is to become the co-sponsor for your recruits and partner with a powerhouse primary sponsor team. That way you can leverage their proven systems, training, and credibility to attract agents to join eXp while you still earn 7 levels of revenue share.

Here’s why it matters: Without a strong sponsor line, attracting and keeping agents is an uphill climb. Your recruits will want to know what kind of onboarding, coaching, and resources they’ll get. If the only answer is “me,” you’re asking them to buy into an untested solo act. By teaming up with a proven sponsor team, like Smart Agent Alliance, as the primary sponsor, you can instantly leverage their full stack of value to attract agents. Meet the proven sponsor teams guidelines and you can even earn the use of the sponsor’s value for your personal use.

By promoting a strong sponsor to be the primary sponsor, you still get credit as the co-sponsor, meaning you participate in 7 levels of revenue share. The difference is, now your recruits stay longer, produce more, and bring in their own agents because they’re plugged into a sponsor line with a track record of winning. Co-sponsoring isn’t just a workaround; it’s the leverage play that lets you build a downline without building the infrastructure from scratch. Learn more about eXp co-sponsorship here.

Do I Need to Choose a Sponsor to Join eXp Realty?

No, but skipping it means no extra systems, coaching, or credibility to help you grow. If you want a downline, pair with a proven primary sponsor and step in as co-sponsor where you’ll still earn 7 levels of rev share while your recruits get top-tier support.

Does eXp Assign Me a Sponsor If I Leave the Field Blank?

No. eXp’s current practice is to leave your upline blank if you don’t name a sponsor. You can fix it before you’re active by contacting eXp Support, but once active, your only option is leaving for 12 months and rejoining.

Yes. Without a sponsor, the revenue share from your deals goes into a bonus pool for someone else’s Tier 1–3. They won’t know you, so they won’t help you because they don’t even know you’re paying them.

You’ll get eXp’s baseline tools, training, and community, but nothing extra. No private masterminds, no done-for-you marketing systems, no onboarding help. If you want those, choose a sponsor team that actually delivers them.

A strong upline gives your business layered support with multiple leaders, proven systems, and a network invested in your success. Plus, it provides you with a value stack to attract your own downline for passive income.

Yes. The right team can accelerate production, shorten your learning curve, and set you up for long-term passive income. Yes, but it’s harder. Without a sponsor line, you lose the systems, events, and credibility that make it easier to attract and keep agents. Partner with a sponsor team that already has a full recruiting engine like a branded attraction site, leadership-led calls, and follow-up campaigns. Smart Agent Alliance gives you all of this on day one so you can start enrolling agents without building the infrastructure yourself.
